name: Frontend Profile Genius
author: mariondorsett

sections.description:
Allow users to edit their profile from your branded page instead of using the default WordPress profile. Buttons are included for the visual and text editors to make adding the shortcode quick and easy. Gutenburg is not currently supported.

Features:
* Can only be used on Page post types, and only used once on the page.
* UI templates can be overridden in active theme.
* Uses AJAX to update user profiles.
* Allows user to change their password.
* Will warn administrator if shortcode is in use on a post type other than page.
* Will allow a user, other than administrator role, to delete their account. (Users with published content must be deleted by an administrator user.)

Currently, the plugin does not support all of the default profile options, and does not integrate with other plugins using action hooks.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/frontend-profile-genius/ directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Open or create a new page.
  4. Use the buttons provided in the visual or text editor to add the [frontendprofilegenius] shortcode, or add it manually.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/frontend-profile-genius/ directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Open or create a new page.
  4. Use the buttons provided in the visual or text editor to add the [frontendprofilegenius] shortcode, or add it manually.

I don’t like the way the form looks can I change it?

Yes, copy the frontend folder to your active theme, and modify the UIs all you want.

Can I add custom fields to the profile form?

No, you can not add additional fields to the profile, the will not be save when the user submits the form.

Do you plan on making it so I can add custom fields to the profile UI?

Yes, eventually you will be able to add custom fields, however there is no road map when this functionality will be available in the plugin.

What happens if a user tries to access their profile when they’re not logged in?

The default UI is set to redirect the user to the log in page.
